## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
certs <-read.csv("C:\\Users\\jeff\\OneDrive\\Books\\Prob and Stats\\Data\\certs.csv")

model01 <- lm(scores~Practices, data = certs)
summary(model01)

results <- data.frame(cbind(
  rbind("n", 
        "Sample Mean",
        "Sample Stdev",
        "Sample Var",
        "Minimum",
        "Lower Quartile",
        "Median",
        "Lower Quartile",
        "Maximum"),  
  rbind(nrow(certs),
        round(mean(certs$scores),4),
        round(sd(certs$scores),4),
        round(var(certs$scores),4),
        round(min(certs$scores),4),
        round(quantile(certs$scores,1/4),4),
        round(median(certs$scores),4),
        round(quantile(certs$scores,3/4),4),
        round(max(certs$scores),4)),
  rbind(nrow(certs),
        round(mean(certs$Practices),4),
        round(sd(certs$Practices),4),
        round(var(certs$Practices),4),
        round(min(certs$Practices),4),
        round(quantile(certs$Practices,1/4),4),
        round(median(certs$Practices),4),
        round(quantile(certs$Practices,3/4),4),
        round(max(certs$Practices),4))
  ))

names(results)[1] <- "Statistic"
names(results)[2] <- "Scores"
names(results)[3] <- "Practices"

#results

library(knitr)
knitr::kable(results[,1:3], "pipe")
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
library(ggplot2)
ggplot(certs, aes(x = scores, y = Practices)) +
  geom_point(size=3, shape=16, col='dodgerblue') +
  labs(title = "Training Scores",
       x = "",
       y = "") +
  theme(axis.line = element_line(arrow = arrow(angle = 30,
                                               length = unit(0.15, "inches"),
                                               ends = "last", 
                                               type = "closed")))
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
